greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: row n is 0^(n-3), 1, 0, 1.
comment: Let A129686 = matrix M, with V any sequence as a vector. Then M*V is the alternate term sum operator. Given V = [1,2,3,...], M*V = [1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14,...]. The analogous operation using A097807, (the pairwise operator), gives [1, 3, 5, 7, 9, 11, 13, 15,..]. Binomial transform of A129686 = A124725. A129686 * A007318 = A129687. Row sums of A129686 = (1, 1, 2, 2, 2,...).
formula: As an infinite lower triangular matrix, (1,1,1,...) in the main diagonal, (0,0,0,...) in the subdiagonal and (1,1,1,...) in the subsubdiagonal; with the rest zeros. (1, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0,...) in every column.
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
mathematica: Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, 12}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 10 2019 *)
program: (PARI) tabl(nn) = {t129686 = matrix(nn, nn, n, k, (k<=n)*((k==n) || (k==(n-2)))); for (n = 1, nn, for (k = 1, n, print1(t129686[n, k], ", ");););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 12 2014
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Apr 28 2007
